Package frechetDistance

Class ApproxFrechet

java.lang.Object
frechetDistance.ApproxFrechet
All Implemented Interfaces:
InterruptionMeasure<Polygon>, Measure<Polygon>
public class ApproxFrechet
extends java.lang.Object
implements InterruptionMeasure<Polygon>
The fréchet distance between two Polygons.

This class provides an implementation of the Measure interface for Polygons. It can be used to approximate the fréchet distance up to the desired degree of accuracy.

Author:
Anton Ballmaier
See Also:
Polygon

    • DEFAULT_PRECISION

      public static final double DEFAULT_PRECISION
      The default precision value
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • precision

      private double precision
      The precision of the approximation

    • tabularDecider

      private final boolean tabularDecider
      Whether to use the conventional tabular fréchet decider.

  • Constructor Details

    • ApproxFrechet

      public ApproxFrechet()
      Constructs a new default ApproxFrechet object.

      As the FrechetDecider it will use FrechetDeciderPath, the default precision is DEFAULT_PRECISION.

    • ApproxFrechet

      public ApproxFrechet​(boolean tabularDecider)
      Constructs a new ApproxFrechet object. It can be specified if the typical tabular decider for the fréchet distance should be used.

      The default precision is DEFAULT_PRECISION.

      Parameters:
      tabularDecider - whether to use the typical tabular decider for the fréchet distance

    • ApproxFrechet

      public ApproxFrechet​(double precision)
      Constructs a new ApproxFrechet object approximating the fréchet distance to the given precision.

      As the FrechetDecider it will use FrechetDeciderPath.

      Parameters:
      precision - the desired precision of distance calculations
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the precision is not positive

    • ApproxFrechet

      public ApproxFrechet​(double precision, boolean tabularDecider)
      Constructs a new ApproxFrechet object approximating the fréchet distance to the given precision. It can be specified if the typical tabular decider for the fréchet distance should be used.
      Parameters:
      precision - the desired precision of distance calculations
      tabularDecider - whether to use the typical tabular decider for the fréchet distance
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the precision is not positive

  • Method Details

    • distanceCapped

      public double distanceCapped​(Polygon p, Polygon q, double max)
      Approximates the fréchet distance to the precision of this instance. If the distance is greater than the given maximum, the approximation is interrupted and Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY is returned instead. The returned value will differ from the real fréchet distance at most by this instances precision value.
      Specified by:
      distanceCapped in interface Measure<Polygon>
      Parameters:
      p - the first polygon to be compared
      q - the second polygon to be compared
      max - the maximum distance of the given polygons for which the distance calculation should be performed
      Returns:
      the approximated fréchet distance of the given polygons
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given polygons have different dimensionality

    • getPrecision

      public double getPrecision()
      Returns the current precision value.
      Returns:
      the current precision

    • setPrecision

      public void setPrecision​(double precision)
      Sets the precision to the given value. The precision must be >0.
      Parameters:
      precision - the desired precision of distance calculations
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the precision is not positive

    • approximate

      private double approximate​(double min, double max, FrechetDecider decider)
      Binary approximation of the fréchet distance using a given fréchet decider.
      Parameters:
      min - a known lower bound of the fréchet distance
      max - a known upper bound of the fréchet distance
      decider - the decider used for approximation
      Returns:
      the approximated fréchet distance

    • getBounds

      private double[] getBounds​(Polygon p, Polygon q)
      Calculated upper and lower bounds for the fréchet distance.

      These bounds are constructed using the longest segment in any one of the two polygons and their discrete fréchet distance.

      Parameters:
      p - the first polygon to be compared
      q - the second polygon to be compared
      Returns:
      the lower and upper bound of the fréchet distance given as length 2 array, where the 0th element is the lower and the 1st element is the upper bound

    • getDecider

      private FrechetDecider getDecider​(Polygon p, Polygon q)
      Returns an instance of the FrechetDecider used for this ApproxFrechet.
      Parameters:
      p - the first polygon to be compared
      q - the second polygon to be compared
      Returns:
      the required instance, a FrechetDeciderTabular if tabularDecider is set to true, a FrechetDeciderPath otherwise
